Content: We created a smart chatbot that answers questions about company documents using Artificial Intelligence
Think of it like having a helper robot that reads all company papers and remembers them so whenever you ask a question it can look through documents and give you the answer
It's a program that runs on a computer listens for questions from people and sends back answers
RAG equals Retrieval Augmented Generation. It means: Find information plus Give smart answers. Like when you search for something in a book AND then explain it in your own words
Uses Azure OpenAI a super-smart AI from Microsoft. It's like having a really smart tutor that understands questions and can write natural answers that make sense
Uses JWT Tokens secret passwords. Only lets logged-in users ask questions. Admin can log in with username admin and password admin123
Python - The computer language we used to build everything. Like the language a robot understands
FastAPI - This lets people access the chatbot through the internet. Like the front desk of a building that handles visitors
Stored in sample_docs folder with company_policy.txt for company rules and benefits_info.txt for worker benefits
Azure OpenAI is the super-smart AI brain. FAISS helps find similar documents quickly like an index in a book
Pytest helps make sure everything works like a checklist
Checks if chatbot is awake - Ask Are you working
Welcome message - Says Hello What can I help
Shows chatbot info - Ask What version are you
Log in with username and password - Username admin and Password admin123
Ask a question - Example What is the remote work policy
Test how good the AI is - Scores how well it answers
app folder contains the chatbot code
app/main.py - The main control center
app/services/auth.py - Handles login
app/services/azure_openai.py - Connects to AI brain
app/services/rag_service.py - Smart reading system
app/ui/index.html - Website interface for users
data/sample_docs folder - Where company documents are stored
tests folder - test_api.py and test_services.py - Tests to check everything
requirements.txt - List of tools needed
